message.content:
We first compute each ratio as follows:

1. Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio:
 • From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities is –10,442,735.47.
 • From the income statement, the Net Profit is 3,744,117.89.
 • Thus, the ratio is:  
   Ratio = (–10,442,735.47) / (3,744,117.89) ≈ –2.79

2. Current Assets Turnover Ratio:
 • Using the ending values from the balance sheet, the Total Current Assets are 29,413,723.95.
 • From the income statement, the Total Revenue is 28,572,608.70.
 • Hence, the ratio is:  
   Ratio = 28,572,608.70 / 29,413,723.95 ≈ 0.97

3. Quick Ratio:
 • Quick Assets = Total Current Assets – Inventory  
   = 29,413,723.95 – 7,400,000.00  
   = 22,013,723.95
 • Current Liabilities (ending) are 8,028,630.43.
 • Therefore, the Quick Ratio is:  
   Ratio = 22,013,723.95 / 8,028,630.43 ≈ 2.74

Below is the solution in the required JSON format:

{"solution": {"Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-2.79", "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.97", "Quick Ratio": "2.74"}}
